user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_irq_register_controller:
```c
int metal_irq_register_controller(struct metal_irq_controller *cntr)
{
	int irq_base;
	struct metal_list *node;

	if (cntr == NULL) {
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	metal_list_for_each(&irq_cntrs, node) {
		if (node == &cntr->node) {
			return 0;
		}
	}

	/*
	 * Allocate IRQ numbers which are not yet used by any IRQ
	 * controllers.
	 */
	irq_base = metal_irq_allocate(cntr->irq_base, cntr->irq_num);
	if (irq_base == METAL_IRQ_ANY) {
		return -EINVAL;
	}
	cntr->irq_base = irq_base;

	metal_list_add_tail(&irq_cntrs, &cntr->node);
	return 0;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No code fragment in this function is statically unreachable. Each return is conditional and can be exercised under plausible runtime conditions: the initial return (cntr == NULL) is reachable when a NULL pointer is passed; the return inside the metal_list_for_each is reachable if the controller node is already in the list; the return after metal_irq_allocate is reachable if the allocator reports METAL_IRQ_ANY; and the final assignment, list insertion and return are reachable when allocation succeeds and the node was not already present. There are no statements following an unconditional return, no dead labels, and no unreachable case/default branches within this function. (Note: full certainty that the loop body and allocation return values can occur depends on definitions of metal_list_for_each and metal_irq_allocate, but within this function as written there is no syntactically unreachable code.)
